definitions.definition: a tall upright post, spar, or other structure on a ship or boat, in sailing vessels generally carrying a sail or sails.
examples: spar, boom, yard, gaff, foremast, mainmast, topmast, mizzen-mast, mizzen, royal mast a ship's mast

definitions.definition: a tall upright structure on land, especially a flagpole or a television or radio transmitter.
examples: flagpole, flagstaff, pole, post, rod, upright; Moreaerial, transmitter, pylon "the mast on top of the building"Moreaerial, transmitter, pylon the mast on top of the building

definitions.definition: (in the US Navy) a session of court presided over by the captain of a ship, especially to hear cases of minor offenses.
the fruit of beech, oak, chestnut, and other forest trees, especially as food for pigs and wild animals.
